instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Intermittent Trackpad
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Board a customer brought in. Track pad will sometimes stop working about 5 minutes after full boot. If it gets past 5 minutes with it working it will stay on until a full restart. Only happens in the first 5 minutes within logging in

corrosion on the Track pad cable - replaced
Replaced track pad
Corrosion on <RESISTOR>R8155</RESISTOR> & had low resistance - Cleaned & replaced, resistance measured good
Corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C5120</CAPACITOR> - Cleaned, tested good.
Replaced <CHIP>U4810</CHIP>
Tried with 2 known good cables & track pads and they still go out sometimes around the 5 minute mark after boot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Intermittent Trackpad
threads.message:
Check the <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI</SIGNAL> resistors.
Inspect R/<TRANSISTOR>Q4860</TRANSISTOR> for corrosion and resolder them.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Intermittent Trackpad
threads.message: All <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI</SIGNAL> resistors measured good resistance. Lifted R/<TRANSISTOR>Q4860</TRANSISTOR> & resoldered. Still stops working after a couple minutes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Intermittent Trackpad
threads.message:
Change TP connector; was probably affected by corrosion.
Also check <TRANSISTOR>Q4800</TRANSISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R4843</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Intermittent Trackpad
threads.message: TP Connector replaced. <TRANSISTOR>Q4800</TRANSISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R4843</RESISTOR> measured good, re-soldered just to make sure. Still stops working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Intermittent Trackpad
threads.message: Post <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> voltages, when TP stops working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Intermittent Trackpad
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Intermittent Trackpad
threads.message:
So the SPI mode is corectly maintained.

Do PRAM reset, test with USB macOS.
I do not expect software issue, but is better to discard.

Possibly accumulated crap underneath CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Intermittent Trackpad
threads.message:
Pram reset done with 3 chimes
Also tried with a new SSD with a fresh OS.
SMC is a little dirty underneath, could that be causing an issue? I can reball, if you think its worth a shot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Intermittent Trackpad
threads.message: Always reball SMC, if note corrosion close to it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Intermittent Trackpad
threads.message: SMC Reball did not work sadly

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Intermittent Trackpad
threads.message:
"Possibly accumulated crap underneath CPU"
Did you try to heat it?
